column4: anyone knows what the "Motif" is what opera is nagging about when i start it?
motif is a widget set (an old one) - like GTK and QT
install openmotif
ty.
do i need the whole openmotif, or is there some libraries that could be downloaded through apt?
deejoe: thats a very good question - I had never realised that openmotif wasn't in apt!
deejoe: looks like "lesstif" should be good enough?
wow. i stumbled upon the same page i was twenty minutes ago. boy how retarded is that you have to fill out some forms to have packages.
btw. deejoe would prolly appreciate if he wouldn't be bothered :D
oopsie :D
can ya let me know if it works please
yes. i'm still looking for a place to download the openmotif
or even better: find some useful packages from apt
I mean try lesstif2 from apt - I know openmotif would work
lesstif2 is an implementation of motif which is in apt
this is like the retardest thing ever; you have register / fill license / whatever to get a piece of that software
oh. great. i typed lesstiff in apt-cache and got nothing. wonder why :)
my apt doesn't find it.
oh - well, if its not in there, it might be in one of the extra sources I've got lol
it gives only libxt6 which i already have.
might be. i have extra resources for some other packages too. can you give me urls?
